cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.GT, cs.SI, cs.DM. 

The paper deals with graph layouts, which are a fundamental topic in computer science. The use of layered separators is a novel technique that can be applied to a variety of graph problems, including graph layout. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper also deals with planar graphs, which are a common topic in computational geometry, so cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is also a likely category. The paper also uses graph theory concepts such as vertex colouring and edge partitioning, which are related to cs.GT (Graph Theory). The paper also mentions the use of 3D grid drawings, which are related to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper mentions the use of separators, which are a common tool in cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics).
